intro: Hybanthus enneaspermus var. densifolius, commonly known as the dense-leaved hybanthus, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae, characterized by its small, showy flowers and dense foliage. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy surface and a prominent venation pattern. This variant is distinguished by its more densely packed leaves compared to other varieties within the same species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests.
